channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report E-2024120069
item.description:
Report E-2024120069

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-12T12:24:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 17:36 PM ET, NBM contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Bessemer, AL. The spill consists of approximately half a gallon of Carboguard 635 Part A, which released from 2–5-gallon metal pails due to a forklift blade puncturing the containers prior to arrival, impacting the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they cleaned the spill with absorbents and place the contents into 1–55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024110473
item.description:
Report E-2024110473

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-10T12:24:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/11/2024, 0835 hours, personnel in the CSXT Yard in Montgomery, Alabama discovered GATX 33805, a loaded tank car of Sulfuric Acid, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Southern States Chemical, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-11-11-00087). Marion Environmental, Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the frangible disk in the car’s non-reclosing pressure relief device had ruptured and approximately one gallon of product has slosh leaked onto the top of the car as a result. Contractor personnel replaced the blown rupture disk, verified a surge protector was present, confirmed appropriate outage in the tank, and decontaminated the top of the car. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Clay Chester (912-944-7107).
